info.name: Legacy-Ping-Prod
info.description:
Sample Postman Collection for Directory REST API covering the supported operations for the following endpoints:

Directory entry
Subtree
Schema

NOTE: API calls are using Basic Auth, however bearer token auth may be used and there is a sample ROPC call to obtain an access token from PingFederate included. You can use the resulting bearer token in API calls by changing Authorization from "inherit auth from parent" to "Bearer Token" and pasting in the token.


Assumptions: 

1. Have configured a REST ADMIN user and given permissions for operations. (see below for a sample admin and ACI samples)

dn: ou=Service Accounts,ou=People,dc=example,dc=com
objectClass: top
objectClass: organizationalUnit
ou: Service Accounts

dn: uid=RestAdmin,ou=Service Accounts,ou=People,dc=example,dc=com
objectClass: top
objectClass: person
objectClass: organizationalPerson
objectClass: inetOrgPerson
sn: Administrator
cn: Rest Admin
ds-privilege-name: proxied-auth
ds-privilege-name: password-reset
userPassword: password
uid: RestAdmin

dn: dc=example,dc=com
changetype: modify
add: aci
aci: (target="ldap:///dc=example,dc=com")(targetattr="*||+")(version 3.0; acl "Rest Admin should be able to proxy as users"; allow(proxy) userdn="ldap:///uid=RestAdmin,ou=Service Accounts,ou=People,dc=example,dc=com";)
aci: (target="ldap:///dc=example,dc=com")(targetattr="*||+")(version 3.0; acl "Rest Admin should have full permissions"; allow(all) userdn="ldap:///uid=RestAdmin,ou=Service Accounts,ou=People,dc=example,dc=com";)
aci: (extop="1.3.6.1.4.1.30221.2.6.17")(version 3.0; acl "Grant access to the Multi Update Extended Request for the rest-api-client account"; allow (all) userdn="ldap:///uid=RestAdmin,ou=Service Accounts,ou=People,dc=example,dc=com";)
aci: (target="ldap:///dc=example,dc=com")(version 3.0; acl "Rest Admin should have full permissions"; allow(export,import) userdn="ldap:///uid=RestAdmin,ou=Service Accounts,ou=People,dc=example,dc=com";)


2. Schema has been defined for certain attributes (like salary) so as to test certain PATCH functionality (see below for sample schema that may be copied into 99-user.ldif and ldapmodify to apply objectClass to people branch)

dn: cn=schema
objectClass: top
objectClass: ldapSubentry
objectClass: subschema
cn: schema
attributeTypes: ( salary-OID NAME 'salary' SYNTAX 1.3.6.1.4.1.1466.115.121.1.27 SINGLE-VALUE USAGE userApplications X-ORIGIN 'RFC 4524' )
attributeTypes: ( 1.3.6.1.4.1.32473.3.1.9.4 NAME 'managerName' EQUALITY caseIgnoreMatch SUBSTR caseIgnoreSubstringsMatch SYNTAX 1.3.6.1.4.1.1466.115.121.1.44{256} X-ORIGIN 'Directory Server Example' )
objectClasses: ( SalaryObjectClass-OID NAME 'SalaryObjectClass' SUP inetOrgPerson MAY ( salary $ ubidEmailJSON ) X-ORIGIN 'RFC 4524' )

bin/ldapmodify --modifyEntriesMatchingFilter "(objectClass=inetOrgPerson)" <<+
dn: ou=People,dc=example,dc=com
changetype: modify
add: objectClass
objectClass: SalaryObjectClass
+

3. Have assigned manager attributes to users to test expand functionality (see below for a sample ldapmodify to add a manager attribute to a user object)

bin/ldapmodify <<+
dn: uid=user.1,ou=people,dc=example,dc=com
changetype: modify
add: manager
manager: uid=RestAdmin,ou=Service Accounts,ou=people,dc=example,dc=com
+

item.name: Get metadata about the API and server

request.description:
Directory entry endpoint

A GET request on the base endpoint, /directory/v1, returns metadata about the server and API. It also returns a list of configured schemas allowed on the server.

item.name: Get the current authenticated user

request.description:
Directory entry endpoint

In addition to retrieving a specified resource by providing the distinguished name, you can get the record of the currently authenticated user by calling the alias GET /directory/v1/me.

item.name: Get all users

request.description:
Directory entry endpoint

the GET /directory/v1/{dn} operation returns the directory entry specified by its distinguished name (dn).

item.name: Retrieve a single user entry and all attributes

request.description:
Directory entry endpoint

the GET /directory/v1/{dn} operation returns the directory entry specified by its distinguished name (dn).

item.name: Retrieve a single user entry and all attributes Copy

request.description:
Directory entry endpoint

the GET /directory/v1/{dn} operation returns the directory entry specified by its distinguished name (dn).

item.name: Retrieve a single user based on hniUid

request.description:
Directory entry endpoint

the GET /directory/v1/{dn} operation returns the directory entry specified by its distinguished name (dn).

item.name: Retrieve a single user and include attributes only

request.description:
Directory entry endpoint

includeAttributes

Specifies the attribute or attributes in the entry that should be included in the response.

These request parameters accept a comma-separated list of attributes to either include or exclude from the response entries. They also support the following aliases as values:

    *

    Refers to all user attributes of the resource.

    _operationalAttributes

    Refers to all operational attributes of the resource.

item.name: Retrieve a single user and exclude attributes

request.description:
Directory entry endpoint



    excludeAttributes

    Specifies the attribute or attributes in the entry that should be excluded in the response.

These request parameters accept a comma-separated list of attributes to either include or exclude from the response entries. They also support the following aliases as values:

    *

    Refers to all user attributes of the resource.

    _operationalAttributes

    Refers to all operational attributes of the resource.

item.name: Retrieve a single user entry with include and exclude attribute logic

request.description:
Directory entry endpoint

For example, includeAttributes=*&excludeAttributes=sn returns all user attributes except sn, but excludeAttributes=*&includeAttributes=sn returns no attributes (except DN).

item.name: Create a new entry

request.description:
Directory entry endpoint

The POST /directory/v1 operation adds a new entry to the directory. The request body must contain all of the required attributes as defined in the schema. If there are no required attributes defined in the schema, you can submit a valid create request with only the _dn attribute in the request body.

item.name: Update an entry with PUT

request.description:
Directory entry endpoint

the PUT /directory/v1/{dn} endpoint modifies the entry specified by its distinguished name. Attribute values specified in the request body are updated; existing attributes omitted from the request maintain their current values. Attribute values set to null in the request body are removed from the entry.

item.name: Password change

request.description:
Directory entry endpoint

The PATCH /directory/v1/{dn} endpoint functions just like an LDAP ldapmodify operation. Similar to the PUT update operation, the PATCH operation does not allow partial changes to a JSON object.

The request body requires the modificationType property, which supports the following four types of modifications:

    add

    Adds the attribute value (or values) specified in the values property.

    remove

    Removes the attribute value (or values) specified in the values property.

    set

    Replaces all the values in the specified attribute with the value (or values) specified in values property.

    increment

    Changes the integer value of the attribute by the amount specified in the values property. The request values should contain a single number, and the attribute must be a single-value or a multiple value integer type. If the attribute is a multiple values integer type, the increment gets applied to all the values. For example, if the attribute had [1, 2] before the increment and the increment had values of 5, then after the increment, the attribute would have [6,7].

item.name: Lock/Unlock account

request.description:
Directory entry endpoint

The PATCH /directory/v1/{dn} endpoint functions just like an LDAP ldapmodify operation. Similar to the PUT update operation, the PATCH operation does not allow partial changes to a JSON object.

The request body requires the modificationType property, which supports the following four types of modifications:

    add

    Adds the attribute value (or values) specified in the values property.

    remove

    Removes the attribute value (or values) specified in the values property.

    set

    Replaces all the values in the specified attribute with the value (or values) specified in values property.

    increment

    Changes the integer value of the attribute by the amount specified in the values property. The request values should contain a single number, and the attribute must be a single-value or a multiple value integer type. If the attribute is a multiple values integer type, the increment gets applied to all the values. For example, if the attribute had [1, 2] before the increment and the increment had values of 5, then after the increment, the attribute would have [6,7].

item.name: Rename an entry

request.description:
Directory entry endpoint

The PUT /directory/v1/{dn} endpoint functions like an LDAP moddn operation for moving or renaming one LDAP entry when the _dn attribute is included in the request. To change the DN of an entry, both the new DN and the naming attribute, the attribute used in the entryâ€™s RDN (relative distinguished name), must be present in the specified entry, even if the naming attribute is not changing. This rename operation can be in the same request as other attributes are modified. However, an error from either the rename or the modify portions of the request causes the entire operation to fail.

Note: If an entry is renamed and modified in one request, a Multi-Update Request Extended Request (OID 1.3.6.1.4.1.30221.2.6.17) is used. The request can fail if no ACI is created to allow a user to use this request, even if the user has permission to perform modify and rename operations independently. The following sample shows a multi-update ACI:

(extop="11.3.6.1.4.1.30221.2.6.17")(version 3.0; acl "Grant access to the Multi Update Extended Request for the rest-api-client account"; allow (all) userdn="ldap:///uid=rest-api-client,o=example";)

item.name: Move an entry by modifying parent DN

request.description:
Directory entry endpoint

You can also change the parent DN, in addition to or independent of the RDN, in order to move the entry. The new parent DN must point to an existing entry and the naming attribute must still be provided, even if the RDN does not change.

You can also modify other attributes in addition to the parent DN in this request.

item.name: Delete an entry

request.description:
Directory entry endpoint

The DELETE /directory/v1/{dn} operation deletes the entry specified by its distinguished name from the directory.

When successful, the response returns a 204 NO CONTENT message.

Note: Only one entry can be deleted in a delete operation. Subtree delete is not supported. Delete operations on an entry with children results in a 400 BAD REQUEST response.

request.description: Directory entry endpoint example

request.description: Directory entry endpoint example

item.name: Retrieve a group

request.description: Directory entry endpoint example

item.name: Search a subtree

request.description:
Directory subtree endpoint

To retrieve a list of entries under a subtree of an entry, use the {dn}/subtree endpoint. This endpoint requires the searchScope parameter. The supported search scopes are:

    baseObject

    Returns only the object directly described by the base DN.

    singleLevel

    Returns only the entries that are immediate children of the base entry.

    wholeSubtree

    Returns the base entry and all of its descendants.

    subordinateSubtree

    Returns the descendants of the base entry, but not the base entry itself.

The server will enforce the max page size if not specified by the client.

item.name: Search a subtree using paged results

request.description:
Directory subtree endpoint

To retrieve a list of entries under a subtree of an entry, use the {dn}/subtree endpoint. This endpoint requires the searchScope parameter. The supported search scopes are:

    baseObject

    Returns only the object directly described by the base DN.

    singleLevel

    Returns only the entries that are immediate children of the base entry.

    wholeSubtree

    Returns the base entry and all of its descendants.

    subordinateSubtree

    Returns the descendants of the base entry, but not the base entry itself.
    
All list requests are paged. The limit parameter specifies the page size. However, the page size can be smaller than requested, either because the server has a configured maximum page size or because you have reached the last page and there are not enough entries to fill the page.

The next link enables navigation forward from the current page to the next page. The directory service does not support a previous link to move backward from the current page.

The size value on the returned object shows the actual number of entries returned in the request.

The searchScope parameter value is encoded in the cursor parameter in the next link URL. 
 
The search scope does not need to be provided on subsequent requests.

item.name: Search a subtree and include/exclude attributes

request.description:
Directory subtree endpoint

To retrieve a list of entries under a subtree of an entry, use the {dn}/subtree endpoint. This endpoint requires the searchScope parameter. The supported search scopes are:

    baseObject

    Returns only the object directly described by the base DN.

    singleLevel

    Returns only the entries that are immediate children of the base entry.

    wholeSubtree

    Returns the base entry and all of its descendants.

    subordinateSubtree

    Returns the descendants of the base entry, but not the base entry itself.

 The searchScope parameter value is encoded in the cursor parameter in the next link URL. 
 
 The search scope does not need to be provided on subsequent requests. 
 
 This endpoint also accepts the includeAttributes and excludeAttributes query parameters.

item.name: Search a subtree and filter results

request.description:
Directory subtree endpoint

To retrieve a list of entries under a subtree of an entry, use the {dn}/subtree endpoint. This endpoint requires the searchScope parameter. The supported search scopes are:

    baseObject

    Returns only the object directly described by the base DN.

    singleLevel

    Returns only the entries that are immediate children of the base entry.

    wholeSubtree

    Returns the base entry and all of its descendants.

    subordinateSubtree

    Returns the descendants of the base entry, but not the base entry itself.

 The searchScope parameter value is encoded in the cursor parameter in the next link URL. 
 
 The search scope does not need to be provided on subsequent requests. 
 
 The GET /directory/v1/{dn}/subtree endpoint supports a SCIM filtering parameter to limit the returned result set to those entries meeting the specified criteria.
 
 Filtering is done before pagination of the response data. The filter parameter is encoded into the cursor pagination parameter; it only needs to be provided in the first request.

item.name: Retrieve the schema for a specific object class

request.description:
Directory schema endpoint

The GET /directory/v1/schemas endpoint returns a list of all configured objectClass entities on the server. If no objectClass entities are configured on the directory server, the request returns an empty list.
